solution_line_template: Julie caught half the amount of Tabitha's {tabitha_candy} pieces so {tabitha_candy}/{half_divisor} = <<{tabitha_candy}/{half_divisor}={julie_candy}>>{julie_candy} pieces of candy caught by Julie

Carlos caught twice the amount of candy as Stan's {stan_candy} pieces so {twice_multiplier} * {stan_candy} = <<{twice_multiplier}*{stan_candy}={carlos_candy}>>{carlos_candy} pieces of candy caught by Carlos

All together, Tabitha caught {tabitha_candy} pieces, Stan had {stan_candy}, Julie had {julie_candy} and Carlos had {carlos_candy}, so there were a total of {tabitha_candy}+{stan_candy}+{julie_candy}+{carlos_candy} = <<{tabitha_candy}+{stan_candy}+{julie_candy}+{carlos_candy}={total_candy}>>{total_candy} pieces of candy
